Job Title: Director Environment Health Safety

Location: Greater Houston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
About Us: We are a dynamic and innovative leader in the engineering industry, dedicated to providing cutting-edge solutions to our clients. With a commitment to excellence and safety, we strive to push the boundaries of what's possible while ensuring the well-being of our employees and the communities we serve.Position Overview: We are seeking a highly qualified and experienced Director of Safety to join our team in Houston, TX. The Director of Safety will be responsible for developing, implementing, and overseeing comprehensive safety programs and initiatives to ensure a safe work environment for all employees and contractors.Key Responsibilities:Develop and implement safety policies, procedures, and programs in compliance with federal, state, and local regulations as well as industry best practices.Conduct regular safety inspections and audits to identify hazards, assess risks, and recommend corrective actions.Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to integrate safety considerations into project planning and execution.Provide leadership and direction to the safety team, including hiring, training, and performance management.Establish and maintain effective communication channels to promote safety awareness and encourage employee engagement in safety initiatives.Lead incident investigations to determine root causes, identify lessons learned, and implement preventive measures.Monitor and analyze safety performance metrics to track progress, identify trends, and drive continuous improvement.Stay current on industry trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes related to safety management.Serve as the primary point of contact for safety-related inquiries, inspections, and audits from regulatory agencies and clients.Champion a culture of safety excellence through education, recognition, and celebration of achievements.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in occupational health and safety, engineering, or a related field; advanced degree or professional certification (e.g., CSP, CIH) preferred.Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in safety management, preferably in the engineering or construction industry.Thorough understanding of OSHA regulations, safety standards (e.g., ANSI, NFPA), and risk management principles.Proven track record of developing and implementing effective safety programs that reduce incidents and injuries.Strong leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and motivate others to prioritize safety.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey complex concepts to diverse audiences.Analytical mindset with the ability to collect, analyze, and interpret data to drive decision-making.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and safety management software.Ability to travel as needed to various project sites and corporate offices.Benefits:Competitive salaryComprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance401(k) retirement plan with company matchPaid time off and holidaysProfessional development opportunitiesDynamic and collaborative work environment

Experience Level (if available): Director
